column4: Ok loosing my mind.  Trying to start an app called OCCiviewer yet it complains "ImportError: libqt.so.3: cannot open shared object file"  Yet all qt pacakges are installed.  Any ideas?
Ok loosing my mind.  Trying to start an app called OCCiviewer yet it complains "ImportError: libqt.so.3: cannot open shared object file"  Yet all qt pacakges are installed.  Any ideas?
which version of qt do you have installed?
I believe I have 3 and 4 .. quite a few qt packages installed.
does "ldd OCCiviewer | grep libqt" return anything?
a simple ldd OCCiviewer alone says not a dynamic executable
perhaps it's a script. try ldd on the called binary.
It is .. I see this at the bottom exec python2.4 ${PREFIX}/OCCIviewer.py "$@"
do you have the package python-qt3 installed?
yes ..
you might try modifying the script to call the most recent version of python installed on your system. the problem is not that python can't see the library, but that it can't load it.
and it might simply not work on your system. you can also try contacting whoever you got the program from.
it is correct.
have a look at "cssh"
will do .. looking into cssh
are you running a 64-bit version of the operating system?
yes Ubuntu Hardy 64b
required reading: http://www.ex-parrot.com/pete/upside-down-ternet.html
.. great page.
not really, unless the drives themselves are of poor quality, of course.
thats what I was thinking.
